He was directly and indirectly responsible for the death of millions of people, including the recent large number....

If we are to go to war w/ Iran the Constitution dictates that we declare war. A war without a Congressional declaration is a recipe for feckless intermittent eruptions of violence w/ no clear mission for our soldiers. Our young men and women in the armed services deserve better.
The question today is whether the assassination of Soleimani will expand the war to endanger the lives of every American soldier or diplomat in the Middle East?

President Trump viscerally understands that the toppling of Saddam Hussein made Iran stronger. Soleimani, like Hussein, was an evil man who ordered the killing of Americans. Yet, the question remains, whether his death will lead to more instability in the Middle East or less.

Clay’s words still ring true: “A declaration of war is the highest and most awful exercise of sovereignty…such a vast and tremendous power ought not to be confided to the perilous exercise of one single man.”
When Henry Clay lost his son in the Mexican American War in 1847, he spoke to a public gathering in Lexington, which included a young Congressman Abraham Lincoln in the crowd.

I called Laura, a teacher, to say thank you. We agreed: We need a teacher in the White House!

It’s apparent some regard an embassy as just some office building. 

An embassy is the sovereign territory of a nation. 

Twice in the last 40 years #Iran invaded or attempted to invade the sovereign territory of the United States.

All three of my brothers served in uniform. I know the sacrifices we ask of them and their families. Trump’s actions put every service member and diplomat in the region at risk. This is a moment for vigilance—for Americans to speak up and speak out. No more Middle East wars.

Donald Trump ripped up an Iran nuclear deal that was working. He’s repeatedly escalated tensions. Now he’s assassinated a senior foreign military official. He’s been marching toward war with Iran since his first days in office—but the American people won’t stand for it.

We’re on the brink of yet another war in the Middle East—one that would be devastating in terms of lives lost and resources wasted. We’re not here by accident. We’re here because a reckless president, his allies, and his administration have spent years pushing us here.

As the former chair of the Senate Committee on Veterans Affairs, I have seen up close the pain, death, and despair caused by war. And I know that it is rarely the children of the billionaire class who face the agony of reckless foreign policy.

Let me repeat a warning I gave in 2002: “War must be the last recourse in our international relations. And as a caring nation, we must do everything we can to prevent the horrible suffering that a war will cause.”

2. Reintroduce & vote on @RepRoKhanna’s bipartisan NDAA amendment, which blocks $ offensive action to Iran.

This amendment passed the House w/ bipartisan support not long ago, and was later gutted in negotiations. We can bring it back as a standalone bill.

Congress now has a moral and legal obligation to reassert its power to stop this war and protect innocent people from horrific consequences.

We have two immediate options:

1. Vote on a War Powers Resolution, which requires Trump to attain Congressional approval.

2.

War advocates start off saying “we all want peace, but...” or “it’s too late...” & frame a pro-peace agenda as naïve to realpolitik.

Don’t give into this gaslighting. The same folks selling us Iraq and selling us this latest provocation of violence. We cannot repeat this cycle.

Right now is the moment to decide if you are pro-peace or not.

The cheerleaders of war, removed from its true cost, will gladly convince you that up is down - just as they did in Iraq in ‘03.

But war does not establish peace.
War does not create security.
War endangers us all.

Last night the President engaged in what is widely being recognized as an act of war against Iran, one that now risks the lives of millions of innocent people.

Now is the moment to prevent war & protect innocent people - the question for many is how, publicly & Congressionally:

We cannot allow him to drag us back into another war. We must speak out.

We must do more than just stop war with Iran.

We must firmly commit to ending U.S. military presence in the Middle East in an orderly manner.

We must end our involvement in the Saudi-led intervention in Yemen.

We must bring our troops home from Afghanistan.

@RepRoKhanna Esta enmienda pasó la Casa de Representantes con apoyo bipartidario hace poco, y fue después descartada en negociaciones.  Podemos traerla de regreso como un proyecto de ley autónomo.
2. Reintroducir & votar a favor de la enmienda bipartidaria al NDAA de @RepRoKhanna, la cual bloquea $ para acciones ofensivas en contra de Iran.

Tenemos dos opciones inmediatas:

1. Votar por una Resolución de Poderes de Guerra, la cual requiere a Trump obtener aprobación del Congreso.
El Congreso ahora tiene la obligación legal y moral de reafirmar su poder para parar esta guerra y proteger a gente inocente de las horribles consecuencias.
No se dejen engañar.  Las mismas personas que nos vendieron Iraq nos están vendiendo esta última provocación de violencia.  No podemos repetir este ciclo.

La guerra nos pone a todos en peligro.

Los defensores de la guerra empiezan diciendo: “todos queremos paz, pero . . .” o “es demasiado tarde . . .” & enmarcan una agenda a favor de la paz como ingenua a la realidad política.

Ahora es le momento de decidir si estas o no a favor de la paz.

Los porristas de la guerra, removidos de su costo real, felizmente te convencerán que arriba es abajo – de la misma forma que lo hicieron en ’03.

Pero la guerra no establece la paz.
La guerra no crea seguridad.

Anoche el Presidente cometió lo que es ampliamente reconocido como un acto de guerra contra Iran, un acto que ahora arriesga la vida de millones de personas inocentes.

Ahora es el momento para prevenir la guerra & proteger a gente inocente.

Y aun existen aquellos que se burlan de la ciencia que dice que tenemos 10 años para arreglarlo tratando de decirles a miles de personas desplazadas por los desastres que están “reaccionando exageradamente.”

Esto es solo el comienzo de nuestra nueva realidad climatológica.  

Debemos de reducir dramáticamente el CO2 para salvar nuestro planeta. https://twitter.com/manwithoutatan/status/1212523804620152832 QT @manwithoutatan I want to give some perspective for people not from Australia.
More Aussie land is currently burning than exists in the entire country of Belgium. The smoke is causing breathing problems in New Zealand, 2,000km away. Half a billion animals have been killed. Eight people are dead.

Estoy muy orgullosa de @JulianCastro y su campaña.

El se postuló con propósito e intencionalidad. I’m so proud of everything we’ve accomplished together. La mayor - & y quiero decir la MAYOR – razón por la cual puedo trabajar para el público de esta manera es xq dependo de donaciones comunitarias.

No dependo en le gran dinero o los partidos para los ricos para financiar mi elección. https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1212059088290566144 QT @nowthisnews Relive @AOC’s most inspiring moments from 2019 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ENH16BPXsAAnynn.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1212018750553239553/vid/320x320/R3Y9JDe09imP-MU4.mp4?tag=13

Cuando estaba más abajo, luché con el pensamiento de que nunca llegaría a ser algo.

Para aquellos que están pasando lo mismo: ¡Sigan adelante!

En la ultima década, perdí a mi papá, regresé al Bronx, luché en contra de la ejecución hipotecaria en contra de mi familia, sufrí con las deudas estudiantiles, & trabajé turnos en restaurantes por años. https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1212059088290566144 QT @nowthisnews Relive @AOC’s most inspiring moments from 2019 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ENH16BPXsAAnynn.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1212018750553239553/vid/320x320/R3Y9JDe09imP-MU4.mp4?tag=13
